poem:
"Ode to Forgotten Tides"

Torn between iron and ocean,
A prophecy written in the rolling hills of Wales.
Warriors clashing, Celtic echoes rebound,
The western shore hums of past's dance.
Run, but in the heart's dirge of lost history,
Perceive sunken secrets, wave-carved narratives,
Unearth the music of crumbled empires.
Time's legion remains, profound, tempest in silence.
